title: Grenfell families accuse Labour leadership of 'tone deaf' attempt to defend fire brigade
text:
Grenfell Tower families accused the Labour leadership of a “tone deaf” attempt to defend London Fire Brigade after a damning report found its handling of the disaster had cost lives.

Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn robustly defended the fire service yesterday despite an official inquiry concluding it had been “gravely” underprepared for the blaze that killed 72 people in June 2017.

Grieving family members last night accused senior Labour figures of deflecting blame from the fire service for political reasons. Others demanded that senior fire chiefs - including London Fire Commissioner Dany Cotton - are prosecuted for manslaughter.
